events.description: The benchmark KOSPI fell more than 3% to around 4,995, dropping below the 5,000 mark.
A decline in US tech stocks driven by concerns over AI-related capital spending.
A sell-side sidecar was briefly triggered in KOSPI 200 futures during early trading due to intensified losses.

facts.fact_text: The KOSPI index fell more than 3% to approximately 4,995 on Friday.

evidences.evidence_text: The benchmark KOSPI fell more than 3% to around 4,995 on Friday, extending losses below the 5,000 mark

facts.fact_text: Samsung Electronics and SK hynix shares both declined by more than 3%.

evidences.evidence_text: Samsung Electronics and SK hynix falling more than 3% each and dragging the index lower

facts.fact_text: A sell-side sidecar was triggered in KOSPI 200 futures during early trading.

evidences.evidence_text: a sell-side sidecar briefly triggered in KOSPI 200 futures during early trading

facts.fact_text: Hyundai Motor shares fell 5.1%, while SK Square fell 6.2% and Hanwha Aerospace fell 6.1%.

evidences.evidence_text: notable decliners including Hyundai Motor (-5.1%), LG Energy Solution (-3.7%), SK Square (-6.2%), Hanwha Aerospace (-6.1%), and HD Hyundai Heavy Industries (-4.4%)

claims.claim_text: Weakness in US tech stocks weighed on local semiconductor heavyweights.

evidences.evidence_text: as weakness in US tech stocks weighed on local semiconductor heavyweights

claims.claim_text: Excessive AI-related capital spending could pressure profitability and valuations across major tech names.

evidences.evidence_text: driven by concerns that excessive AI-related capital spending could pressure profitability and valuations across major tech names

evidence.evidence_text: weakness in US tech stocks weighed on local semiconductor heavyweights
dragging the index lower amid heavy foreign investor selling
concerns that excessive AI-related capital spending could pressure profitability and valuations
Losses were further intensified by program-driven trades
